Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 10:19AM jhawks67 wrote: Thank you so much Julee. That is on my agenda for Monday, to call a breast clinic. I recently relocated to Missouri and I just researched my options as to where I can go. I found a breast research clinic in Columbia, Missouri. I was just unsure of what type of doctor/clinic I needed. I had a rough nite last nite with my pain level. All I have heard from doctors since Feb is "wear a sports bra, dont use caffiene and take ibuprophen". (All of those I have done since I was a teen!) I will keep you posted and thanks again!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: jhawks67 wrote: I am 40 yrs old. I was diagnosed with fibrocystic breast disease 10 years ago. At that time I had two non cancerous lumps removed from each breast. I had not had any problems at all after that until Feb. of this year. Only affecting my right breast, I had burning pain. I had the mammogram which was fine, labs showed my hormone levels were fine and the ultrasound showed I had bleeding cysts. The doctor said it is a "fluctuation thing". In fact it is not. I have been in constant pain ONLY with the right breast. I have also been "thrown" between several doctors and each one tells me it is all part of fibrocystic breast disease. In May, I went to a new doctor because I found a large (almost egg sized) hard lump and two dimples under my right breast. He made no comment on the dimples and told me that the hard lump is "a part of my breast". I also continue to have pain in my armpit and an on and off hardness with the upper part of breast wall. I am unable to lift due to my chest wall hurting. I am absolutely lost as to what to do. I have been to 9 doctors since Feb and feel like giving up, I have an arsenal of medications that I take for pain and even they dont work. Ive had my breasts for 40 years and I know when something is not right, it is just getting the doctor to listen that is the hard part!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2008 03:38PM jhawks67 wrote: Hi shirlann and thank you for your reply. I have recently moved to Missouri and I am in between doctors. I have found a clinic in my area (womens clinic). My plans are to call them tomorrow and schedule an appointment. I am tired of the run around the other doctors have given me and I plan to go to this appointment (if they accept my insurance) and I am not taking my records from previous doctors. I plan to start over and say here my boob is, do something about it. I am tired of the sleepless nights and lazy doctors who only base their diagnosis on your medical records rather than listening to me and offering other tests or solutions. I have noticed today that on this same breast it looks like little needle pokes all around my breast..from the outer part where lump is clear to the underside where the two dimples are. Thanks again
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2008 04:02PM jhawks67 wrote: Thank you for your reply..mary lou and swimangel. No doctors have made orders for MRI, biopsy or labs (other than hormone levels and thyroid which all checked out great). I will be requesting one at my next appt tho you can bet  on that. I went to a very nice GYN and she said my right breast did not appear normal, she then sent me to a breast surgeon, he ordered an ultrasound to check for abnormal cysts to aspirate. none were found at that time so thats all the farther that went. The last doctor I did see told me the lump was a part of my breast? well my left breast didnt feel that way!..I have bad pain under my nipple today ugh! When my breast isnt experiencing sharp stabbing pains, it is a deep throbbing pain. I am always walking around holding my breast or rubbing it and sometimes I dont realize i am doing it. Hubby reminded me in church today to let go of my breast! oops.
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 10:29AM jhawks67 wrote: Thank you for your reply Nash. Yes, it is very frustrating. Yes I have seen two breast surgeons. The first I seen in Feb. At that time, I did not have this huge lump. I did however have the bleeding cysts. He did no exam, did not look at my ultrasound or mammo scans I took with me. He told me " take ibuprophen, dont drink coffee, wear a sports bra and come back and see him when I had a lump". Then he billed me 270$. grrrr. Needless to say, I left there in tears because he wouldnt listen to me. I did see another breast surgeon a month later who said all that I was going thru was fibrocystic related and he ordered another ultrasound to check for abnormal cysts. None were found but the begining of the large lump showed on the ultrasound. I questioned the ultrasound tech and he said it was just a dense spot. That was done in April. The "dense" spot is now the hard, large lump. Hope that makes sense because it sure doesnt to me! We then moved to Missouri and now I am lost again and inbetween doctors. I have not had a mammo since finding the hard lump. The doctor here that I seen was not concerned and said that it is a part of my breast.
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2008 03:26PM jhawks67 wrote: Thanks Shirlann....I just read the report in the package ...I figure I own that package lol...It stated that I had a large cyst mass at 10 oclock and the cysts appear to have debris and signs of hemmoraging..Now, you would think that the cysts would have been aspirated then but they werent...so I went to another doc who ordered another ultrasound with orders to aspirate any abnormal cysts ...none found!..but i did point out my lump and the tech said it was just MORE density...I also have my mammogram that was done at the same time, that report reads there was LESS density? I will not leave my appointment on tuesday until they do a biopsy or arrange for one grrrrr...This lump is a large oval and smooth lump...man I am sooo angry and tired of sleepless nights..my neck hurts and the shooting pains in my nipple are killer! thanks for letting me vent lol other than my boob, I have had a good day and hope everyone else has too!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2008 05:50PM jhawks67 wrote: Hi Laura...the first thing I asked the doctor was "was I right? was there something there?" He said yes there was. He said he knew the minute he cut me open, he could see it. He told me that the mass he took out had several bleeding cysts in it and was the type of mass that had a high potential to turn cancerous if left unattended. He said that the mass was indeed b9 (YAY!) and that by me being persistant in getting answers (10 doctors) and knowing my body, that helped. He wants me back every 6 months for testing as he said I was high risk. I am trying not to dwell on the fact that I have had soo many doctors that always said "oh its just fibrocystic breast disease" and get angry with them. I urge other women that if you know something is wrong , then keep pressing forward to find that doctor that will care and help...so, I celebrate my finding..but I will always have that 6 month checkup in the back of my head to worry about! Thanks all for your encouragement and I will be back daily to offer my support, love and hugs just like I have recieved here!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2008 05:53AM jhawks67 wrote: Good morning all, thanks for your posts. After all that I went thru, I will ALWAYS worry. Even as I am healing still from my biopsy I will feel the hardness behind my breast and go hmmm is that supposed to do that? My doctor said to call him anytime if I had any questions. I am real comfortable with him and his whole staff. My doctor reassured me when I showed him the hardness behind the incision and said it was normal. He said to call him on Monday if I am still worried. Hmmm...wonder if he would mind if I called him every day for the next 6 months. Hope everyone has a wonderful weekend. I am off to a benefit for my uncle who has skin cancer. He is not good at all and it will be just days now. rrs? doc has mri, labwork and diagnostic mammo scheduled for me in 6 mo.

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 10:04AM jhawks67 wrote: Thank you for your response. No biopsy has been ordered. The doctor did not seem concerned.  This lump is rather large. I feel it at nite when I try to sleep. The lump is rather strange to me. It has the egg shape and is large and it extends towards my armpit and then I have the hardening of the upper breast as I mentioned before. On the breast, I have a two inch scar (upper) from my previous biopsy/lumpectomy 10 years ago. This scar has a "caved in" appearance. That also was not a concern to my doctor. Ugh!  The appearance of the breast compared to my left breast is different also.

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2008 02:36PM jhawks67 wrote: Hi again everyone, I have a question and was wondering if anyone could answer it. I had my old and first set of films from my mammo and ultrasound mailed to me so that I can take them to my upcoming appointment. It had dawned on me when I looked at the slip of paper in with the ultrasound , the doctor had wrote to the radiologist tech to look at the ten oclock area on my right breast. This was done in February. The doctor told me after reading the results that it was a cyst. My question is....dont cysts fluctuate or go away? My lump that I had mentioned to you all here is at the ten oclock position on that breast. It has not gone away IF it is the cyst she is talking about and as a matter of fact it has gotten larger..does this make any sense?
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 04:50PM jhawks67 wrote: Hi spar..funny, I was just thinking about you today! lol..crazy..im just really tired is all..kinda worried about tuesdays appointment..guess im just afraid i wont get any help just like before. I noticed when i checked myself this morning the incision on my other breast(left) from my previous biopsy years ago is also dimpled in.That incision is on the lower line of my nipple. Looks like a sore or buise..idk..I have absolutely no pain in the left breast..i will get BOTH of them looked at tho..thanks for thinking of me today.! I will keep you posted..hugs
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 01:37PM jhawks67 wrote: I I had my appointment today and I was amazed! I actually found a doctor to listen to me. He examined me and did find the lump, he said it was rather large. He did the ultrasound himself and then sent me to radiology for a more thorough ultrasound. He then informed me that from what the ultrasound said, it appeared to be fibrocystic tissue but he said that cannot be confirmed until a biopsy is done. I go this friday for my pre op tests and then he will do an open biopsy on Monday. He said he will go thru my old scar from my biopsy years ago which is two inches long but he said he will probly have to go an inch farther to remove the lump. From there, my lump goes to pathology for testing. He (doc) said that I should have never had to go so long taking pain pills and that something should have been done long ago. Now that my poking and prodding is done for the day, I am off to a much needed nap! Hugs all!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2008 05:25AM jhawks67 wrote: Hugs and good morning everyone. I have to share this with everyone. Last week while doing my pre op tests, I sat by this very pretty young lady of 47. She recognized the folder I held from the cancer center and asked me if I had breast cancer. She did have breast cancer and shared her story with me. She had been to several doctors last year and like me, was told it was normal. In Dec of last year she had a mammogram, ultrasound, and biopsy that all came back ok. She then went to the same doctor that I am currently seeing because she felt something was not right and he ran more tests and she was diagnosed with stage 2 cancer in Feb of this year. She told me she was meeting with the anethisist group (as was I) to prepare for her breast reconstruction. I was so excited for her! It was like two ships passing in the night. I dont know her name but I wished her well and she did me too. I had my open biopsy yesterday. The doctor went from saying it was a lump to a mass and he cut me in a totally different spot (about 3") than what he had planned. I am very sore in the armpit area as well as the incision area today, but for the most part it has been okay. I go back this Friday for my results!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 03:01PM jhawks67 wrote: Hey suz..good for you!! Im glad you are going to the breast center..keep me posted..remember, you know when something is not right with your body so speak up! I finally went back to work today...I still have that tiredness and a little ouchy still where the incision is but I dont have the pain I had before..yes, I am finally sleeping! Good luck on thursday, I will be thinking about you! For teresa48, I wish you the best hun...I think the same thing (what are they not telling me?) But I sure got a keeper of a doctor this time and I can call him anytime.  I also took the nerve meds for chest pain (my chest bones hurt) after they took the mass out, it relieved the pressure on the nerves..THAT was the first thing I noticed on my second day after surgery was that I did not have that pain anymore. This med was also used for mental nerves too..Right now ALL that I am taking is a tylenol pm at nite to help me sleep..After going thru 10 doctors that knew nothing, I am sure you can imagine the arsenel of narcotics and anti inflammatory pills I had and I also hated taking them but the pain was unbearable..Now I only take the tylenol pm...YAYYYYY. Hugs for you hun, keep me posted!
